Articles.Content:
Awesome space exploration game, hinging on alternate physics.

http://anynowhere.com/bb/layout/html/doors/local/frameset_noctis.html
i would play it but its not for windows 64bit :\'(

Dosbox! http://www.dosbox.com/

Or get a DOSbootdisk.

Seriously, it\'s among some of the better dos games out there.

Can\'t get past the interface. I\'m sure there\'s a game there, I can see it off to the side in ultra-low-res, but if you don\'t follow conventions and I have to read the manual to find out just how to even access the main menu (let alone use it) then it\'s a fail.

(hint: the method used to access the menu is retarded - See if you can figure it out!)

I challenge anyone to jump into this with no reading and try to figure out what [snip] is going on. I gave up after having to look at the manual twice - I didn\'t even get to the part where it told me how to actually interface with the interface... because [snip]. 

Edited March 26, 2019 by Deddly
I play Noctis!  Its a multiplayer game, but as far as I can tell, nobody else is there.  Its a deserted galaxy.

Spoiler

It's not necro. It's paleo.

5 hours ago, kerbiloid said:
  Hide contents

It's not necro. It's paleo.

 

Its not considered necroposting if its still relevant

I want to try this game out, actually. Anyone know a good way to get these files on to a virtual machine that's not connected to the internet?

Also, that website looks really weird, but I like it.
